subject: Re: [junit] Order of testclasses in suite junit 4.7

Hi, Mike.

Yes, in JUnit 4.7, those classes will run in the order shown.
Ho=
wever, many people find a lot of benefits from writing test suites
that are=
 useful, fast, and correct independently from the order of
execution.  Can =
you tell us more about why the order is important to
you in this case,

   =
David Saff

On Tue, Sep 7, 2010 at 2:40 AM, mpetterson@...
<mpet=
terson@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> We are using junit 4.7 and Suite to=
 run tests. If we take a look at the example below ( from the web ...):
>
>=
 import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
> import org.junit.runners.Suite;
>
> @Ru=
nWith(Suite.class)
> @...({
> =A0TestCalculatorAddition.clas=
s,
> =A0TestCalculatorSubtraction.class,
> =A0TestCalculatorMultiplication.=
class,
> =A0TestCalculatorDivision.class
> })
> public class CalculatorSuit=
e {
> =A0 =A0// the class remains completely empty,
> =A0 =A0// being used =
only as a holder for the above annotations
> }
>
> Is it guaranteed that Te=
stCalculatorAddition.class will be executed before TestCalculatorSubtractio=
n.class ? How is the order of execution determined for a suite? Is it possi=
ble in junit 4 to determine order for test classes in suite?
